item.title: Contact
item.description:
I can be reached out at jigyasu [at] outlook.in or jigyasu [at] sktime.net

Some of my relevant accounts on the web:

  • GitHub
  • LinkedIn

item.title: Now
item.description:
What is a now page? Read more about them here.

Update: November 15, 2025

These days I have been working on the benchmarking infrastructure of sktime. We want it to reach a maturity stage where any one can easily reproduce an existing benchmarking experiment and I believe we’re quite close to our goal. This is in continuity to my project from European Summer of Code.

I am also getting interested in the use of machine learning in biology and particulary AI’s application in drug discovery. I reached out to a professor to let me work with her and her lab and luckily she agreed. I will write more about it in the future.

item.title: But What Is European Summer of Code?
item.description:
If you’re reading this, you probably already have an idea of how rewarding it is to contribute to impactful open-source projects. There are several programs like GSoC, LFX Mentorship, SoB, and etcetera, which provides new contributors with opportunities to work on exciting open-source projects and learn a lot all while getting a good stipend.

ESoC or the European Summer of Code is one such relatively new program, the description from their website reads,
